document_data.mainbody:
isherlings were thieves&mdashgenerally children&mdashactive in the Malars Throat slums of Port Nyanzaru as of the late 15 century DR.
Fisherlings were so-named for their tactic of "fishing" for unsuspecting peoples coin purses and other valuables from the high suspension bridges that spanned the Malars Throat ravine. They were known to target individuals wearing unsecured items and satchels that appeared to be carrying valuables. If spotted by their victims, they gleefully reeled in their lines and scattered into the slums, taking cover in the crowds.
The fisherlings were a well-known hazard of visiting Malars Throat as of the late 15 century DR.
